moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. a3 Nf6 4. d3 Bc5: White is ignoring the development of his pieces, which triggers black to play aggressively
moves.5... d5 6. Qe2: More time wasted, developing another piece with Bg5 or Nc3 would have been better.
moves.6... O-O 7. g4 Be6 8. g5: Black now decides it is time for action.
moves.8... dxe4: Opening lines. gxf6 would be followed by gxf3, Qxf3, Nd4 which is good for black
moves.9. dxe4 Nxe4: It is not clear if this sacrifice is correct
moves.10. Qxe4 Bd5 11. Qg4: Better Qf5, after which e4 is not correct becasue of Nc3.
moves.12. Nh4 Nd4 13. Kd1:
This looks doubtfull, putting the King right opposite the black Queen.
White had better find ways to return some material, and activating his paieces in the process
moves.13... Nf3: Threatening Be6+, wining the white Queen
moves.14. Qg3 e3:
Opening more lines.
White best response would seem to be Bd3
moves.15. Bxe3 Nxh4:
The black Bisshop and the black Night are forbidden fruits.
Right now Bd3, Bxh1 was the only good response.
moves.16. Bxc5: This result in a quick checkmate
